snippet: The International Monetary Fund now expects the global economy to grow about 3.1 percent in 2013. That is 0.2 percentage points lower than the fund forecast in April.
abstract: International Monetary Fund updates its economic forecasts, and now expects the global economy to grow about 3.1 percent in 2013, same rate as in 2012; it is 0.2 percentage points lower than the fund forecast in April.
lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund now expects the global economy to grow about 3.1 percent in 2013. That is 0.2 percentage points lower than the fund forecast in April.

headline.main: I.M.F. Trims Global Growth Forecast as Emerging Markets Lag
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Trims Global Growth Forecast as Emerging Markets Lag
